author: igor
title: Bears Club - Club Simulation Game
description: The crypto ecosystem lacks of games with social features, where people can play and socialize at the same time.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea itself is good, but the proposal is rather superficial. It is a game that would, according to the author, merge the world of NFTs with socialization, something that according to him is lacking in the universe of crypto games. Okay, but what would that socialization be like? The author explains that clubs would be created in the forests, from what we can understand, the characters would be bears (probably NFT coined in Cardano). But what would happen in these clubs? What missions would be the basis of the game? How could players showcase their characters? It is not possible to understand in detail what is being passed here, unfortunately. A website is attached, where we have some illustrations (I loved the 3d projection of the bears) and a little about the story, script and contact with the team. I found the site very beautiful, visually, but in terms of content it doesn't deliver much. The white paper is also nothing different from the website (it might have been an error, but when I entered the given link this is what I saw). In general, the impact here could be better measured if the proponent had gone into more detail about the game itself, how NFT coining, socialization between players, universe building, etc.
f6_assessments.q1: We have a script here, but it's pretty sketchy. That is, the phases have little detail. For example in Q1 2022, the only topic is "Airdrop Bears Club 3D NFTs". What would that be, exactly? The construction of these characters? Were the tasks destined for 2021 actually accomplished? If yes, I would like to see the results. Detailing is not absent, but it is insufficient. It doesn't allow for a very clear vision of what would need to happen to make this idea a reality. On the attached website, the same script is available, in a better diagrammed way, but no extra information is given. Regarding staff and funding, there is also a gap in details here. Starting with the monetary breakdown, this is very unspecific. The author states that 70% of the funding would go towards the development of the game. Very vague explanation. Within development, we have several activities, such as design, programming, storytelling, smart contracts?, in short, several things. It would be necessary to understand how this 70% would be distributed. He also says that legal and marketing actions would be needed, but that is also very vague. Everything is vacant, unfortunately. He doesn't dedicate any space in the proposal to present a team that is responsible for the different functions of the game, as I mentioned earlier. He claims to have experience with programming and games involving cryptography. But what did he do within those areas? What kind of relationship does it have with the Cardano ecosystem? About the designers he intends to hire, what would that selection be like? Unfortunately, there are many doubts in the air, not giving a sense of security in his/her team's ability to carry out the proposal in a guaranteed way.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent establishes some KPIs, which relate to the expected results for the passage of time counted in months. It's a good way to audit the proposal, saying about the final results. However, these KPIs cannot, in my view, cover all the complexity of the project. Games are always (almost always, perhaps) quite laborious, difficult to create. For that reason, I would like more detail. Another way that I find here to do the auditability would be through the script. Through it, it is possible to follow the development of the game. But because it is a shallow script, this monitoring would probably also be superficial. In other words: yes, the proposal is auditable, but not perfectly. I suggest that the author invests in detail both in the metrics part and in the roadmap itself, so that we have more specific information to track. It would be interesting for him to gather the data, partial results of each step, bringing them to the rest of the Cardano community. This needs to say about all aspects of the game: marketing, design, NFT, etc. In this way, we would have a lot of confidence that the project was being carried out in compliance.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal's problem statement and solution addresses the objectives laid out in the challenge. The proposal's aim to add value to Cardano by creating a social network platform with play to earn ability through gaming. Furthermore, its key metrics and goals are aligned with the challenge. However, the proposer did not mention on its ability to scale to cater future market demands. Can the game be able to serve more than 10000 bears? Think of millions of bears that want to join game and use it as a platform to connect with other users. Also will it only focus on bears? Will there be other form of character that will be added in the future? Another question on scalability is will the game only be available on browser or will it be available on mobile as well?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer did not provide any verifiable link to their profiles. Please provide verifiable evidence of your relevant experience and skills to successfully implement the proposal. Also please provide in details on the required manpower to implement the project. How many web designer, 3D artist and illustrator are needed? In addition, the proposer did not provide a clear budget breakdown on how will the funds be used. Provide detail budget breakdown, eg. 10000usd will be used for marketing in a span of 5 months (2000usd x 5 months) etc. Moreover, there are no risk management plans in the proposal. If there is additional funding required due to unforeseen circumstances , what will be the contingency plan? Furthermore, this proposal did not explain the technology that is used behind this game. Please provide information such as what engine will it be run on? eg. unity, unreal 5, etc.. How will your game interact with the blockchain? What wallet will be used?
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. Moreover, this proposal has presented a link to their website and social media for voters to keep track of the progress of their work. Furthermore, this proposal also provided the metrics and KPI that define the success of the proposal. However its metric is too focused on the delivery of the game. What about the estimation amount of people that the game aims to bring onboard Cardano? Is it 10000 new users? 5000? Therefore, I rate audibility with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very good proposition. A social and fun play-to-earn game where you can interact with your friends, visiting their clubs, visit popular places in the Cardano Forest where people will be with their favorite bears interacting with each other.
I think it will attract gamers, especially those who love animals, want to be in harmony with nature.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer has shown sufficient evidence to demonstrate the skills and experience needed to implement the proposal, it would be interesting to know the profile of the people involved. It is also important to have more detail regarding the number of people involved, estimate hours and allocated budget to the different work packages for project implementation (this has been provided, but it's too sketchy: "Game Development - 70%,Legal" Consulting - 10%, Marketing - 20%" )
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a club simulation game that follow the play-to-earn business model, it will have an open economy and offer financial benefits to the players, like agriculture simulation genre found in for example Plants vs Undead, Farmville, Wanaka, etc. However, it would be beneficial to have a more detailed roadmap that allows the community to know the level of progress of the project. Ask for a budget of $40000, how this money will be used, e.g. proposer needs to provide total hours worked, pay for each of those jobs,...
This is a very good idea, providing more information would be helpful.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer presents the Bears Club project with the goal of offering a 3D browser game with many social features while still offering everything a crypto game needs. Although it is not specified what a crypto game would need accourding to the proposer vision, this project seems to fully address the challenge by providing a play to earn game.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is quite difficult to evaluate the potential success of the project as the team still needs to hire a Web Designer to improve the website, 3D artist to handle the game 3D assets, and a illustrator to work on the game UI and miscellaneous art material. 
Moreover, the proposer did not share any proof of experience, with the exception of a youtube video linked to the webiste shared in the brief.

Moreover, the Descord group counts as of today about 400 members, which could be a good pool for a demo, but certainly not to assess the game once completed. 
It's reasonable to think that the marketing funds will be used to increase the number of potential users stated above.
f6_assessments.q2:
Apart from the lack of proof of experience, the proposer provided a base webiste which encloses not only the project roadmap, but a faq section, and project story section
Funds allocatiion is mentioned, although it could have been itemized introducing some sub items as done for the roadmap.

f6_assessments.q0:
Problem aimed to achieve with This proposal somewhat addresses the challenge. Gamers in the Cardano community can benefit from the launch of the proposal. I think focusing on the The social aspect of gaming is represented in the proposal is important. The story on the website https://bearsclub.io/ is interesting and it may create a synergy around the climate change-related issues so perhaps increase awareness about nature literacy.  I could not find a connection with the video presented on the youtube channel   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RkqlUjyv4vs
It will be good to present how the proposal can scale to address future challenges of creating social media with fun and some purposeful activities achievements for enhancing the user motivation.
However, I think the Bears Club should be given a chance to build inside Cardano forest, so the bears gather and we can interact with our friends, visit their clubs, visit popular places in the Cardano Forest. Please consider some of the purposeful activities such as transforming behaviours to overcome challenges of climate change.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, Igor seems alone for the moment. I suggest finding other members of the community.  It is not so likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. Just like the social aspect of the game is highlighted it is important to establish a team from the beginning of the project. There are some members in the Cardano4Climate group with an interest in gamification in climate-related issues. Perhaps this can be a good way to get support and cooperate. Proposer’s 7 years of programming experience with extensive knowledge about crypto games is a great asset for our Cardano community. Besides proposal needs to involve other community members to ensure a better plan and budget for the task described.
f6_assessments.q2: It is possible to assess progress in terms of general goals and the roadmap provides milestones. However, the definition of success needs to be further detailed. Including the possible challenges and assumptions. There is only general information about the use of the budget. It is better to identify the use of budget in relation to the different challenges of short, middle and long term success.

solution: The goal for Bears Club project is to offer a 3D browser game with many social features while still offering everything a crypto game needs.
experience: The game is already being developed by a developer who has 7 years of programming experience with extensive knowledge about crypto games.
